name: Thingyan Water Festival
description: The most famous water festival celebrated in April marking the Myanmar New Year.
details: Thingyan, also known as the Myanmar Water Festival, marks the traditional Burmese New Year and is one of the most celebrated festivals in Myanmar. It lasts for several days in April, where people splash water on each other to wash away the sins of the past year and welcome a new beginning.

name: Thadingyut Festival of Lights
description: A festival celebrating the Buddha's descent from heaven with thousands of lights.
details: Thadingyut, the Festival of Lights, is held at the end of Buddhist Lent (October). Homes, pagodas, and streets are decorated with colorful lights and candles to welcome Buddha's descent from heaven after preaching to his mother.

name: Tazaungdaing Festival
description: A celebration with hot air balloons and offerings to monks.
details: Tazaungdaing marks the end of the rainy season and is celebrated with stunning hot-air balloon festivals, especially in Taunggyi. People also offer robes and alms to monks during this time, showing generosity and unity.

name: Kachin Manaw Festival
description: A cultural dance festival of the Kachin ethnic group.
details: The Kachin Manaw Festival is one of the most colorful and traditional ethnic festivals in Myanmar. It features the Manaw dance, performed around tall decorative Manaw poles, symbolizing unity and peace.
